metadata.title: CVE-2023-38472 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Avahi. A reachable assertion exists in theavahi_rdata_parse() function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
avahi-daemon - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
avahi-discover - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
avahi-ui-utils - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
avahi-utils - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-client3 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-common-data - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-common3 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-core7 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-glib1 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
python3-avahi - 0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: avahi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8-6ubuntu1.23.04.2').
